sentence.Network_en: Their sad, Mongolian faces gazed out over the sides of the trucks utterly incurious.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们那蒙古脸丑陋无比, 漠然盯着车下的人群.

sentence.Network_en: She is incurious after she had glanced at a few of these.
sentence.Network_cn: 她浏览了几页后,便失去了好奇心.

sentence.Network_en: My show is an exercise in will - fully ignorant, emotionally based, non intellectual, incurious passion about things.
sentence.Network_cn: 我的节目是练习当一个意志张扬、无知 、 情绪化 、 反智 、 对一切事物充满扬弃好奇心的热情的家伙.

PerfectNetExp.abs: incuriosity 无好奇心incurious 无好奇心的incurment 招致
a. 无好奇心的, 不关心的, 平凡无趣的incurious [ adj ]showing absence of intellectual inquisitiveness or natural curiosity<adj.all> strangely incurious.
incureable 反复, incurious 不关心的, incured 康复期的

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (in the sense 'careless'): partly from Latin incuriosus 'careless, indifferent', from in- 'not' + Latin curiosus 'careful' (see curious); partly from in- 'not' + curious

means.word_mean: 1. showing absence of intellectual inquisitiveness or natural curiosity;

sentences.sentence: "strangely incurious about the cause of the political upheaval surrounding them"

auth_sentence.content: Was Bush this rigid and incurious all his life?
auth_sentence.res_content: Was Bush this rigid and incurious all his life?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Was Bush this rigid and incurious all his life?

auth_sentence.content: In his Cloaths..., he was not only incurious, but too negligent.
auth_sentence.res_content: In his Cloaths..., he was not only incurious, but too negligent.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In his Cloaths..., he was not only incurious, but too negligent.

auth_sentence.content: This could be because he is naturally cautious or because he is incurious.
auth_sentence.res_content: This could be because he is naturally cautious or because he is incurious.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This could be because he is naturally cautious or because he is incurious.
